ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: If you're interested in Sanskrit, take it with David.

I would say that it is a perfect class broken into perfectly digestable, absorbable 50 minute blocks. I would even say it's fun! Professor Brick is fantastic because he is fair, yet has high expectations. Sanskrit is not a spoken language, so we focus on translations. But I feel like I've honestly learned and RETAINED a LOT, even in one semester. I would definitely recommend it to another student, and this is definitely the class I talk most about to friends and family.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: After one semester I feel very confident in my language skills, and ready to continue moving forward.

There a lot of AHA! moments in this class, when I discovered the true meaning or actual formation of a Sanskrit word that I've seen dozens of times in readings on Hinduism or Buddhism...and this is just in the first semester!It is clear that class will prove to be invaluable to my Asian Religion studies.
